thread.title: Krautz, Nederland too much for Central
thread.title_full: Krautz, Nederland too much for Central

author: David Thompson
title: Krautz, Nederland too much for Central
text:
Close Image 1 of 8 
Central's Davion Smith dives to try and put a stop to Nederland quarterback Mitchell Lebaron as he runs the ball during Friday night's game at Nederland's Bulldogs Stadium. Photo taken Friday, October 9, 2015 Kim Brent/The Enterprise Photo: Kim Brent Central's Davion Smith dives to try and put a stop to Nederland... Image 2 of 8 
Central's Devwah Whaley leaps over the pack as he runs the ball against Nederland during Friday night's game at Nederland's Bulldogs Stadium. Photo taken Friday, October 9, 2015 Kim Brent/The Enterprise Photo: Kim Brent Central's Devwah Whaley leaps over the pack as he runs the ball... Image 3 of 8 
Central's Devwah Whaley runs the ball as Nederland's Jacob Jones closes in for the stop during Friday night's game at Nederland's Bulldogs Stadium. Photo taken Friday, October 9, 2015 Kim Brent/The Enterprise Photo: Kim Brent Central's Devwah Whaley runs the ball as Nederland's Jacob Jones... Image 4 of 8 
Central's Harold Redo (left) celebrates with Delvin Bennett, after Bennet brought in a touchdown against Nederland during Friday night's game at Nederland's Bulldogs Stadium. Photo taken Friday, October 9, 2015 Kim Brent/The Enterprise Photo: Kim Brent Central's Harold Redo (left) celebrates with Delvin Bennett, after... Image 5 of 8 
Nederland's Connor Perkins is brought down by Central after completing the pass during Friday night's game at Nederland's Bulldogs Stadium. Photo taken Friday, October 9, 2015 Kim Brent/The Enterprise Photo: Kim Brent Nederland's Connor Perkins is brought down by Central after... Image 6 of 8 
Central's defense closes in as Nederland's Austin Krautz runs the ball up the side during Friday night's game at Nederland's Bulldogs Stadium. Photo taken Friday, October 9, 2015 Kim Brent/The Enterprise Photo: Kim Brent Central's defense closes in as Nederland's Austin Krautz runs the... Image 7 of 8 
Central's Chris Boudreaux looks for an open player as the line holds off Nederland's defense during Friday night's game at Nederland's Bulldogs Stadium. Photo taken Friday, October 9, 2015 Kim Brent/The Enterprise Photo: Kim Brent Central's Chris Boudreaux looks for an open player as the line... Image 8 of 8 Krautz, Nederland too much for Central 1 / 8 Back to Gallery 
Nederland's Austin Krautz scored five touchdowns to help the Bulldogs overcome a 13-7 halftime deficit to defeat Central 35-20 and extend their winning streak over the Jaguars to five games dating back to 2011. 
Krautz scored four of his touchdowns in the second half, finding the end zone on runs of 13, 12, 6 and a 73-yard dash down the right side with 6:23 left in the fourth quarter to seal the win. Krautz also added a seven-yard touchdown reception from quarterback Mitchell Lebaron , who finished the game having completed 9-of-20 passes for 71 yards - midway through the second quarter. Video: Nederland's Krautz talks about performance, win over Central 
"This was huge for the whole team," said Krautz, who finished the game with 231 yards on 28 carries. "We had to win this game. We are on track to win a district title now." 
The win moved Nederland to 4-2 overall and 3-0 in District 22-5A, setting up an undefeated matchup with Port Neches-Groves next Friday. With the loss, Central falls to 2-4 overall and 2-1 in district. 
"We are on schedule," Nederland coach Larry Neumann said. "Two teams were out here playing for a district championship (Friday). But we know it's not over yet." 
Krautz's first of four second half touchdowns gave Nederland its first lead of the game - 14-13 - midway through the third quarter. Central drove the ball into Bulldog territory on the ensuing possession, but a Tavian Mayfield interception on a pass attempt by Central quarterback Chris Boudreaux halted the Jags' momentum. Off the turnover, Krautz scored from 12 yards to give Nederland a 21-13 lead. 
"I read the quarterback's eyes," Mayfield said. "I grabbed the ball and just thought, 'go.' I'm just glad I could come up with a big play." 
The Bulldogs went on to score the first 21 points of the second half to take control of the game after trailing for most of the first half. 
Central had some big plays of their own, including a 49-yard touchdown reception by Delvin Bennett from Boudreaux in the first quarter. Central's Jawon Mitchell also returned a kickoff 85 yards to give Central a 13-7 halftime lead. 
But when it came down to it, Krautz was just too much to handle. 
"He pretty much did what he does every Friday night," Neumann said. "He's not only a fast runner, but he's really a strong runner as well. He just keeps getting better." 
Central running back Devwah Whaley finished the night with 24 carries for 109 yards, but was denied the end zone for the first time in district. Theodrick Foster 's nine-yard touchdown run in the fourth quarter was the only points Central scored in the second half. 
DThompson@BeaumontEnterprise.comTwitter.com/daveth89
